isis.stitle: CAB: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - REAR WINDOW GLASS (BEFORE JULY 1993)

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 7for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

Cab rear window glass (Item 1) is secured in the cab rear window opening with a molded one piece weather seal (Item 6) with integral locking strip insert (Item 2) similar to that used for the windshield.

calloutgroup.callout1: A. SECTION A-A, CUSTOM AND PREMIUM

svcprocinfo.para: The weather seal fits around edge of glass and is so formed that it retains the glass in window opening by fitting over the window body flange (Item 7) opening. Old or deteriorated weather seals should not be reused whenever window glass is replaced.

note.para: There is an optional sliding rear window available. Removal is similar to that shown for the standard rear window.

warning.para: When removing or installing rear window glass, wear gloves.

step1.para: Pry out integral locking strip insert (Item 2) of weather seal (Item 6) with seal tool (Item 1, Figure 4) or a thin blade screwdriver around entire perimeter of glass.
Working with an assistant, one person inside cab and one person outside, gently push glass from inside out.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 7for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

warning.para: When removing or installing rear window glass, wear gloves.

step1.para: Before installing new weather seal (Item 6) or window glass, body flange and glass must be cleaned free of dirt, old sealing compound, wax, etc.
Coat weather seal (Item 6) with a soapy solution or rubber lubricant for ease of assembly.
Position weather seal (Item 6) carefully around edge of rear window body flange (Item 7) opening.
Working from outside the cab, place rear window glass in the channel of weather seal (Item 6) starting at the lower edge of the opening.

With glass completely seated in weather seal channel, start working weather seal locking strip insert (Item 2) down into groove provided with seal tool (Item 1, Figure 4) or dull screwdriver. A second coat of rubber lubricant will simplify installation.

note.para: When replacing rear window glass that is not the re-designed glass assembly, it is recommended that the re-designed rear glass assembly be used.
